text.__SUMMARY__: Conus kostini is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.These snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 60 mm and 100 mm.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs off Balut Island, Southern Mindanao, the Philippines
text.References:
Filmer R.M., Monteiro A., Lorenz F. & Verdasca A. (2012) A new species of Conidae (Gastropoda) from the Philippines. Acta Conchyliorum 11: 37-43.
Puillandre N., Duda T.F., Meyer C., Olivera B.M. & Bouchet P. (2015). One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails. Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1-23
